reviews.review_msg: Semantics with Dr. Han was more difficult than syntax.. There was a lot of math involved. The materials were basically similar to syntax but be prepared to do the math.
Took course in hybrid format. Stay on top of lectures + homework and you'll do great. Textbook optional, everything required is covered in lectures.

(had Han with LING 222 too) The topics about Propositional logics, truth conditions etc... Is difficult for me , but she was able to keep me engaged on the topic.  She would go through all the examples with us, and makes sure we understand. Unlike other professors who give us data and expect us to solve it on our own. Assign are completion based

I would say Han teaches ling322 better than ling324. During the lectures for ling322, she explained everything well in her own words. However, in ling324, she reads off from the powerpoint most of the time. Exams are tough. I love the course tho.
She's a nice person.  But the course is hard.

She's nice, but maybe a little too accomodating to students. The exams are a little tough, but if you have the concepts down you should be fine. If you have a backround in predicate/propositional logic, this class is a total breeze. And she's kinda cute.
seems very interested in the course. unfair tests - very limited time with too many questions. trys hard to impress students
